meanings.definition: The quality of being able to understand or know something without the need for conscious reasoning.
meanings.sent1: Her intuitiveness helped her solve the puzzle without thinking too hard.
meanings.sent2: His natural intuitiveness about people's emotions made him a great counselor.
meanings.sent3: The cat's intuitiveness in finding the hidden treats amused the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The artist's intuitiveness in capturing emotions on canvas was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The intuitiveness of the detective in solving crimes was unmatched in the city.

meanings.definition: The ability to perceive or know something without the need for conscious reasoning.
meanings.sent1: The child's intuitiveness about danger kept him safe in unfamiliar situations.
meanings.sent2: Animals often rely on their intuitiveness to sense approaching danger.
meanings.sent3: The robot's malfunctioning intuitiveness led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her intuitiveness in predicting the weather was like having a built-in meteorologist.
meanings.sent5: The intuitiveness of the old tree in adapting to different climates was astonishing.

meanings.definition: The quality of being instinctive or innate.
meanings.sent1: His musical intuitiveness allowed him to play any instrument by ear.
meanings.sent2: The baby's intuitiveness in knowing when to cry for attention amazed her parents.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's lack of intuitiveness in reading the audience's mood led to an awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's intuitiveness in anticipating the opponent's moves gave him an edge in the game.
meanings.sent5: The intuitiveness of the plant in adapting to various soil conditions was a marvel of nature.
